intro: Nemophila eriocarpa, commonly known as the wooly blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, sky-blue flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, often found in woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
